course.title: Politics at the Margins
course.description: This course examines the political implications of contemporary social marginality, such as being homeless, poor, racially segregated, incarcerated, or undocumented. What is the significance of the spatial metaphor of being at the "margins" of society? How do people come to inhabit this location? We will draw on readings from both political theory and empirical social science research to explore the normative and political concerns at stake, particularly the political invisibility of the marginalized.
